Tech-oriented conference for
web developers & designers

⋆ 04.10.2014. • Conference center Hypo Expo XII • Slavonska avenija 6 ⋆

WebCamp Zagreb is a tech conference built by community for the community. With more than 600 web developers & designers attending last years conference, the concept of sharing experiences and knowledge across different communities in South East Europe becomes even more apparent. This year we are targeting more talks in English.

Call for papers 2014.

26.05.2014.

WebCamp Zagreb is proud to announce that the call for papers is now open. As a tech conference organized by the community for the community, your participation is greatly appreciated. Become one of our speakers.

HURRY UP: First 30 submissions will be given a free ticket!

Start of WebCamp 2014 preparations.

18.05.2014.

Encouraged by past WebCamp Zagreb success, we are continuing our tradition: organizing a tech orientented conference by the community for the community.

With more than 600 web developers & designers attending last years conference, concept of sharing expiriences & knowledge across different communities in South East Europe becomes even more apparent: we are going all english this year!

Call for Papers

26.05.2014.

It’s a great pleasure to invite you to WebCamp Zagreb 2014, a tech conference devoted to web development & design, which will be held on October 4th 2014 in Zagreb, Croatia. This is a call to participate: help us build a great conference once again by becoming a speaker! With great opportunities to network with fellow developers & designers the most important part of every great conference are expert talks. And free pizzas.

It’s all about the community, WebCamp Zagreb is organized by local user groups: Code@Six, FrontmanHr, FutureDEV, Girl Geek Dinners Hrvatska, HUJAK, Javascript Zagreb, Python Hrvatska and ZgPHP.

Before inviting the first visitors, we have to build a great collection of talks.

This is where we need your help. We need your talk; or more of them. Feel free to submit all of your ideas, we have a diverse range of interests so all submissions are welcome! While it’s not important which technology, language or tool you use, let your suggestions be interesting and fresh to a broad audience. Just make the talk web related (even if it’s along shot). We love first hand experience talks!

Talks should be of a technical nature, not promotional. Try to cover both good and bad sides and keep the presentation as objective as possible. If you want to present a specific project, give us an inside perspective. Just keep in mind that we’re looking for tech talks, not sales pitches.

Here’s some ideas to get you started: application architecture, hosting, cloud solutions, software development methodology, application testing, development/design tools, design, client and server side development, mobile web, specific technologies/tools/libraries, SQL or NoSQL databases and data storages, tech experience you love or dislike, managing or web team organization, collaboration tools, distributed or remote teamwork experiences.

All talks are 25 minutes long and this includes the Q&A at the end. This limitation will be strictly enforced to keep the conference schedule on track. It’s highly recommended to limit your talk to 20 minutes to allow 5 minutes for Q&A.

Proposals can be submitted through the CFP Application Form. Call for paper ends on August 1st 2014.

Proposals are evaluated and rated by representatives of each organizing user group. Selected speakers will be contacted directly via e-mail by August 15th.

If you have any questions, free to contact us at talks@webcampzg.org .

Call for Sponsorship

WebCamp Zagreb invites you to become a sponsor for our annual WebCamp Zagreb 2014 Conference which will be held at the Conference center Hypo Expo XII on October 4, 2014.

Started in 2012 by local user groups to promote the exchange of knowledge and experience in healthy cooperation between communities, WebCamp managed to attract visitors from neighbouring countries and the wider region, reaching over 600 visitors last year.

While WebCamp Zagreb is focused on the wider region and international audience, local user groups will also organize the Week of Webcamp, a series of events in the days before main event.

Sponsor this event to gain visibility with our audience and enjoy the fact that your sponsorship will help assure the success of WebCamp Zagreb 2014.

You can find more information about the sponsorship packages in this .pdf file.
